StoryText: My mom wants me off my tablet... she keeps frowning at me, and looking sad. But I am nearly at a new high score on this game! And she hasn't told me to get off outright yet.
Question: Shall I continue playing?

OptionText.Text: Play for a little longer until Mom actually tells me to stop.
Sneak off into another room to carry on playing.
Turn off the tablet. I don't want square eyes.
Hide in the cupboard under the stairs and smash this new record!

OptionResult.Result: I chose to ignore my Mom's subtle clues and then she yelled at me. I turned off the machine really quickly then! I didn't reach a new high score, and Mom's mad.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: Turns out you should always pay attention to your parent's subtle clues. I ignored my mom's wish to get me off my tablet and got told off.

OptionResult.Result: When I snuck off into my bedroom, I won myself at least another five minutes before my mom hunted me down. New high score! But Mom was furious! I'm not allowed my tablet for a week.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: A simple trade: tablet time in exchange for being in your mom's bad books. Books is all I'll be looking at for a week now anyway, so I guess I can work it out.

OptionResult.Result: I switched off the tablet and my mom was immediately happier. No high score for me - I was going to top the leader board! Never mind, I had a good time running around outside instead.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I chose my mom and exercise over letting my eyes go square on my tablet. Healthy choices, people!

OptionResult.Result: It was dark and creepy in there, but my mom couldn't find me! I absolutely smashed the new high score: I'm the best player in the country. When my mom found me though, I've never seen her so angry...
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I know I shouldn't have done it, but hiding in the cupboard under the stairs gave me time to get a killer high score on my game. I don't know if mom will ever trust me to use the tablet again, but I'm going to enjoy the respect of being top of the country for a while.
